"What's the minimum amount of work we can do?" - Overwatch 2

Oh, where do I even begin with the sheer brilliance that is Overwatch 2? It's almost as if the developers decided to take everything that made the first game unique and groundbreaking and thought, "You know what? Let's double down on that." The innovative decision to continue the "unique" tradition of colorful characters and exciting team-based gameplay is truly remarkable. And the fact that they've managed to maintain the "element of surprise" by not actually releasing the game yet is simply awe-inspiring. I must say, the level of creativity it takes to make a sequel that feels exactly like its predecessor is truly unparalleled. Bravo, Blizzard, bravo.

Every painstakingly "new" features serves as a testament to the studio's unwavering commitment to not fixing what wasn't broken. (*sike*) And let's not forget the groundbreaking decision to retain the same maps â€“ who needs new environments when you can relive the same battles over and over again? All in all, Overwatch 2 is a masterclass in creative stagnation and a shining example of how to play it safe while pretending to evolve. Truly a game ahead of its time.

corpo monsters sucking the life out of their art and dev teams for every inflated penny

FYI, you can use bing search rewards to get premium OW coins for free.

Preface, i played 243 hours on overwatch, most on 1 and a couple of really depressing ones on 2. Reached gold before burning out and level 302.
I loved overwatch 1 it was like TF2 on steroids, more compact, focused and with character with a richer skill set. Got hooked up, trained my aim, got quite good. Unfortunately soon after i joined (around season 2) all friends playing quit because they got burned by season 1 competitive (which apparently was hell on earth). So i started playing alone and ranking, eventually reached gold and burned out. 

It was around the time they started the Overwatch league that all the problems started to really sprout. Updates to the meta became slow because fuck if a 16 years old that is getting payed to play a video game can be expected to adapt to changes in a game. Atrocious decisions on character balance and reworks, born from the all inclusive style of character planned but the extremely competitive nature of the game (Symmetra melted people without havint to aim, Junkrat shooting grenades at random and now doesn't even take damage, i think that still stands) or just bad ideas alltogheter (Mercy Valkirye update because Mercy players where hiding like bitches and using their overpowered Ultimate to res a whole team after a fight). Not to mention fun charachters immediately nerfed (Ashe).
I kept following from a distance, sometimes coming back, have a couple of games and then quitting again

THAT SAID: Overwatch 2 is the worse update the game could ever have, it's a sort of miracle for how bad it fucks up and lessens what was a great game, not understand what made the game great.
Let's start with a slimy note, I bought Overwatch 1, i also bought a couple of lootboxes (like an idiot). If you delete the game, make a "second" and bring all the skins from the first and put ridicolous prices on them, I that bought and supported the first game should have them all, they were bundled with the first game, even if the caveat was that you had to "earn" (random) them. Or at least i should be able to keep earning them in the 2. It would also help the game because them there is nothing to strive for in the game, except some dumb achievement. I won't even count those challenges that give so little currency that it would take years to earn anything meaningful.

Now no matter what all the brainlet streamers say, the change to 5v5 from 6v6 is the worse decision they could make, especially with the locked roles.  There is a reason why even when roles where free there was always at least 2 tanks. Between 2 points pass 1 line. 2 tanks made a wall behind which the team could hide, move, change shooting angle, try flanks confident that the team could hold for a little. With just 1 tank, even with a huge health bar, no wall can be built, the only hope is to huddle up behind it and hope it doesn't die, if it does the whole team is fucked. The only meta is now deathball, if someone tries to flank, as soon as it gets spotted by the other huddled team it gets shredded. The only one that could do it and have fun is Sombra (my main in 1 that brought me to burning because i was adamant in using her in competitive and climbing rank, when soldier would've been a thousand times easier but boring). I'm sure soon after they nerfed Sombra to the ground but i didn't stick to see.

Another huge change is the lack of crowd controls. I at least get the idea of this, the first person nature of the game makes crowd controls feel awful, you are forced to just see the screen and wait. Problem is the game was built with them in mind. McCree(don't remember the new name) neeeeds them to survive, otherwise everyone can just push right into his face and melt him. And if the problem was that for him was a easy way for him to get headshot, i'd say skill issue, i had a 70% precision with him at my top, no flashbang needed to get headshots. 

Last the PVE, they worked a lot on it (allegedly) then dropped and scaled it down. Problem is they are asking a stupid price for it (Shadows of Change much?) like they are selling what was originally planned but in reality they find out they could sell the PvE events that used to be free, truly a genius move. As genius as putting the game on Steam. And Gabe i better not see you delete reviews because of "brigading", This fucking revies/rant is a long time coming

Sorry for it, maybe i will come back and write it again better, i doubt it.

> Pays 60 bucks for overwatch 
> No updates for 3 years
> The same game gets released as oVErWaTCh2 
> Characters locked behind a battlepass

Yea no, I am so glad this game came up on steam so I can download it and leave a negative review. My god blizzard how pathetic these people have become, the company, the people in it, just ew
I don't recommend this game, but instead i recommend you watching Overwatch porn. It's wayyy better.

id rather watch 350 hours of overwatch porn than play a minute of this game
The game originally was amazing. So far I can't think of a single thing blizzard has done right so far. What a shame

OW1 was fine, I don't know why they did sod all with it for 5 years and then cancel the only exciting addition. Blizzard had gold and then sat on it until it was too late. This game peaked years ago. It is now a corporate, burnt out shell of a once class-A drug-like endorphin machine. Overall OW2 is not an improvement and the 'sequel' update is marketing BS intended to draw in new players not support the current player base and fans. I've played this game for a long time so I do genuinely enjoy the game. However, the predatory monetization of the game as well as the continually questionable decisions by the devs make this something I can't honestly recommend. Also, releasing heroes that MUST be unlocked via the battlepass literally makes this game pay-to-win as often times, especially for the current new hero, the new hero is very powerful at release.
